channel.title: Homes on Daniele Antonioli
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Daniele Antonioli

item.description: Biography I’m doing a PhD in Computer Science at the Singapore University Design and Technology (SUTD), advised by Pawel Szalachowski. I work on various aspects of cyber-physical and wireless systems security. Currently, I’m a visiting researcher at Helmholtz Center for Information Security (CISPA) advised by Nils Ole Tippenhauer. I hold a BS and MS in Electronics and Telecommunications Engineering from the University of Bologna (UniBO). I spent three months at the University of Massachusetts (UMass Amherst) as a research assistant to prepare my master thesis about random number generation and testing advised by Wayne Burleson and Riccardo Rovatti.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Summer 2018: TA Security Principles (SPR) MSc, University of Oxford UK, Prof K.B. Rasmussen CIA, Authentication, Cryptography, RSA, Protocols Exercises and presentation of Scyther Fall 2017: TA 50.012 Networks BSc, SUTD Singapore, Prof N.O. Tippenhauer TCP/IP, UDP, BGP, SDN, HTTP, REST, TLS, tunnels, NAT Lab session, grading, office hours Spring 2017: TA 50.020 Security BSc, SUTD Singapore, Prof N.O. Tippenhauer CIA, Cryptography, Exploitation, TLS, CTF, Network Security Lab session, grading, office hours 2013-2015: Private teacher Grad/undergrad: linear algebra, calculus, programming (C, Pascal) High school: math, physics, programming (C++) 2013: External Professor for High School Final Exams (Italy) LAMP, SQL, PHP, JS, relational DB, MVC, HTTP(S)
